    • Constructor Detail

      • FiniteStateAutomaton

        public FiniteStateAutomaton​(java.lang.String[] states,
                            java.lang.String[] inputSymbols,
                            java.lang.String[] outputSymbols,
                            java.lang.String[][] data)
        The constructor method of a finite state automaton.
        pre: All parameters are not null. The number of rows in the data is the length of states attribute
        post: A finite state automaton is created.
        Parameters:
        states - The set of states
        inputSymbols - The set of input symbols
        outputSymbols - The set of output symbols
        data - The data of the finite state automaton

    • Method Detail

      • findConnectedAutomaton

        protected abstract java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> findConnectedAutomaton()
        Finds the connected automaton.
        pre: The data attribute is not null
        Returns:
        The connected finite state automaton

      • findSuccessorsOf

        protected abstract void findSuccessorsOf​(int indexOfState)
        Finds all the successor of one state.
        post: The accessibleStates attribute will have a 1 in a position if a state is accessible and has that position as an index and 0 if it is not accessible
        Parameters:
        indexOfState - The index of the state to which you want to find the successors

      • getInitialPartitions

        protected abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getInitialPartitions​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> reducedAutomaton)
        Gets the initial partitions of an automaton.
        pre: reduceAutomaton parameter cannot be null
        Parameters:
        reducedAutomaton - The automata from which you want to obtain the initial partitions
        Returns:
        The initial partitions

      • getSuccessorOf

        protected abstract int getSuccessorOf​(int indexState,
                                      int indexOfInputSymbol)
        Gets the successor of a state given an input symbol.
        pre: indexState must be less than or equal to the number of rows in data attribute and indexofInput must be less than or equal to the number of input symbols
        Parameters:
        indexState - The index of the state in the states attribute
        indexOfInputSymbol - The index of the input symbol in the inputSymbols attribute
        Returns:
        The index of the successor in the states attribute

      • changeIndices

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] changeIndices​(java.lang.String[] row)
        Changes the indexes of the states by their respective names
        Parameters:
        row - The row in which you want to change the indices
        Returns:
        The row with the names of the states instead of their indices

      • assignIndexOfPartition

        protected void assignIndexOfPartition​(int indexPartition,
                                      int indexState)
        Assigns each state the index of its partition
        pre: indexState must be less than or equal to the number of rows in data attribute and indexPartition must be greater than or equal to 0 post: The indexOfPartition attribute has the indices of the partitions of each state. Only the indices of the states that are in a partition are changed.
        Parameters:
        indexPartition - The index of the partition
        indexState - The index of the state in the states attribute

      • getInfoAboutAccessibleStates

        protected java.lang.String getInfoAboutAccessibleStates()
        Gets the information about the accessible states
        Returns:
        The information of the accessible states

        Returns:

      • partitionLoneStates

        private void partitionLoneStates​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> aloneStates,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> prevPartitions,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> newPartitions)
        Partitions the states that were left alone because they came out of a partition
        pre: No parameter can be null
        Parameters:
        aloneStates - The states that were left alone
        prevPartitions - The partition where the lone states came from
        newPartitions - The list where the new partitions will be storage

        pre: The parameter partitions can't be null
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The partitioned partition

      • renameTheStates

        private void renameTheStates​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> data)
        Renames the partitions
        post: The newStates attribute has the new indices reflecting the new partition name
        Parameters:
        data - The partitions

        pre: The data parameter can't be null
        Parameters:

        Returns:
